item.title: Baptism of fire warms Irfan up for final clash with Vietnam - The Star Online
item.description:
Baptism of fire warms Irfan up for final clash with Vietnam  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Malaysia centreback Irfan Zakaria reckons his best is yet to come after surviving his baptism of fire in the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-finals. The Kuala Lumpur player was thrown into the deep end in the second leg against Thailand after Aidil Zafuan Abdul Razak picked up a hamstring injury at the Rajamangala Stadium on Wednesday. And it proved to be a nightmare debut as Irfan scored an own goal minutes after coming in to give Thailand a 1-0 lead in the first half. In the second half, he gave away a free-kick which allowed the host to take a 2-1 lead. There was more drama in the pul...

item.title: Cup final a huge test for Harimau Malaya, says Cheng Hoe - The Star Online
item.description:
Cup final a huge test for Harimau Malaya, says Cheng Hoe  The Star Online

BANGKOK: Malaysia coach Tan Cheng Hoe (pic) reckons that taking the next step and winning the AFF Suzuki Cup will be another huge test for his side. The 10-men Harimau Malaya advanced to the final on away goals after holding defending champions Thailand 2-2 on aggregate in the second leg semi-final on Wednesday. “The players and the team are improving in everything. You can see they’re progressing together. In the final, we play at home first. We need to take our chances there and we need to keep playing the way we’ve been playing and keep up the good momentum,” said Cheng Hoe in the post-m...

item.title: Keeper Farizal out to settle the score with Vietnam - The Star Online
item.description:
Keeper Farizal out to settle the score with Vietnam  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Malaysia goalkeeper Farizal Marlias will have his hands full as the Harimau Malaya brace for Vietnam in the AFF Suzuki Cup final. For Tan Cheng Hoe’s men, it’s a matter of vengeance and redemption – Malaysia lost their their penultimate Group A meeting with Vietnam’s Golden Dragons 2-0, despite being the dominant side in Hanoi on Nov 16. The first leg of the final will be at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil on Dec 11 and the second leg at the My Dinh Stadium in Hanoi on Dec 15. A fired-up Farizal is out to catch the eye and go the extra mile to ensure Malaysia settle the s...

item.title: Malaysia dump defending champs Thailand in semi-final - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia dump defending champs Thailand in semi-final  The Star Online

BANGKOK: Lady Luck was certainly smiling on Malaysia as the underdogs knocked out defending champions Thailand from the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-finals. Ten-man Harimau Malaya advanced to the final on away goal rule after holding the War Elephants to a 2-2 draw in a pulsating affair at the Rajamangala Stadium yesterday. In the first leg, both teams played to a goalless draw at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil last Saturday. The Thais looked to have sealed their berth in the final in the last minute after they were awarded a spot-kick. Syahmi Safari was penalised for a handball and was sent of...

item.title: Malaysia beat Thailand on away goals in Suzuki Cup semis - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia beat Thailand on away goals in Suzuki Cup semis  The Star Online

Malaysia is in the final of the AFF Suzuki Cup! Harimau Malaya, led by coach Tan Cheng Hoe, fought back to hold Thailand to a 2-2 draw in a pulsating affair at the Rajamangala Stadium in Bangkok on Dec 5 night. Malaysia were held 0-0 at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil on Dec 1.

item.title: Adisak apologises for messing up penalty against Malaysia - The Star Online
item.description:
Adisak apologises for messing up penalty against Malaysia  The Star Online

BANGKOK: Thailand’s hotshot striker Adisak Kraison (pic) was clearly distraught after becoming the villain in their AFF Suzuki Cup campaign. Adisak failed to a convert a last ditch spotkick and they crashed out on away goal rules to 10-men Malaysia after the semi-final clash ended 2-2 on aggregate at the Rajamangala Stadium on Wednes­day. Malaysia had twice come from behind to hold Thailand 2-2 with goals from Syahmi Safari (28th minute) and veteran striker Norshahrul Idlan Talaha (71st) after the hosts took the lead through Irfan Zakaria’s own goal (21st) and Pansa Hemviboon’s goal (63rd) ...

item.title: Mission possible - The Star Online
item.description:
Mission possible  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: National team coach Tan Cheng Hoe is in a buoyant mood ahead of the second leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final against Thailand at the Rajamangala Stadium in Bangkok tonight. Cheng Hoe said his men can spring an upset if they can maintain the momentum from the first leg and they need to make their chances count. The 50-year-old coach added that he will have a late fitness test ahead of the match as a few of his players picked up injuries in the first leg. “The players are in good mood. I believe if we continue to play the way we have, we can upset Thailand in this away game,...

item.title: AirAsia flies fans for semi-final match at discounted price Hats off to AirAsia - The Star Online
item.description:
AirAsia flies fans for semi-final match at discounted price Hats off to AirAsia  The Star Online

BANGKOK: The national football team had a massive morale boost in their crucial second leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final match against Thailand at the Rajamangala Stadium – thanks to AirAsia. The Harimau Malaya held the War Elephants to a goalless draw in the first leg at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil last Saturday. The airline had offered a special return ticket for RM349 to Bangkok to spur the team for the return match in Bangkok last night and a total of 160 Malaysian football fans including the Ultras Malaya quickly snapped up the offer. AirAsia Malaysia Chief Operating Officer...

item.title: Syahmi's screamer gives Malaysia half-time advantage - The Star Online
item.description:
Syahmi's screamer gives Malaysia half-time advantage  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Syahmi Safari's thunderbolt has given Malaysia an away goal advantage as they are currently holding Thailand 1-1 in the first half of the AFF Suzuki Cup second leg semi-final match in Bangkok. The Selangor right-back, who received the ball from Syamer Kutty Abba from the middle, drove forward and took a thunderous shot which went past the hapless Chathchai Budprom in the 27th minute. Thailand were the first to draw blood when Malaysian goalkeeper Farizal Marlias' save from a Thitipan Puangchan header was accidentally bundled into the Malaysian goal by substitute Irfan Zakaria...

item.title: Malaysia hold mighty Thais, thanks to the supporters - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia hold mighty Thais, thanks to the supporters  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Thailand were under pressure from the get-go in the first leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final against Malaysia due to boisterous atmosphere at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil on Saturday. Thailand’s national coach Milovan Rajevac said the fantastic atmosphere certainly spurred Malaysia to do their best. “Malaysia played really well. They dominated possession and covered the most distance in the match. They gave 120% but this is only the first leg. The final spot will be decided in Bangkok,” said Rajevac. “We came here with a plan but the players could not execute it. The...

item.title: Malaysia hold defending champs Thai to goalless draw - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia hold defending champs Thai to goalless draw  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia kept their unbeaten record against neighbours Thailand after holding the defending champions to a goalless draw in the first leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil. The Harimau Malaya have not lost to Thailand at home in 47 years and the Thais’ only win on the Malaysian soil was at the 1971 Merdeka Tournament where they won 2-0. While Malaysia kept their bragging rights with a spirited display yesterday, they will face an uphill battle in the second leg in Bangkok on Wednesday. National coach Tan Cheng Hoe was happy they did not co...

item.title: Harimau Malaya’s home record against War Elephants offers no advantage - The Star Online
item.description:
Harimau Malaya’s home record against War Elephants offers no advantage  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The War Elephants will be out to end Harimau Malaya’s invincibility at home in the first leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-finals at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil tonight. Malaysia have not lost to Thailand at home in 47 years and the Thais’ only win on Malaysian soil came at the 1971 Merdeka Tournament where they won 2-0. Thailand coach Milovan Rajevac said records are meant to be broken and will ensure his players play as a team to get a positive result in front of a sell-out crowd of 80,000. Defending champions Thailand are the overwhelming favourites after ending the gr...

item.title: Malaysia counting on Shahrel to be their secret weapon - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia counting on Shahrel to be their secret weapon  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Shahrel Fikri Fauzi will be heavily relied on as Malaysia prepare to face Thailand in the first-leg of the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-final on Saturday. The winger, who made 12 appearances and scored two goals for Thai side Nakhon Ratchasima in the Thai League 1, has been deemed as the key to unlock Thailand’s weaknesses. “Every Thai player that I have faced in their league has always given his best and what sets them apart is their individual skills,” said Shahrel. “Who should we mark? It is tough because all their players are good. “Even without their top players Teerasil (Dangda)...

item.title: 10 sexiest male athletes at the 2017 SEA Games - Star2
item.description:
10 sexiest male athletes at the 2017 SEA Games  Star2

We love that the SEA Games 2017 is being held in Malaysia. Even more reasons to be pleased? These hunky athletes from all over the region are here to compete. It’s time to show how hospitable we can be as host. Here are the 10 dashing dudes to cheer on. HARRY MORRIS, 32 Rugby, The Philippines This Filipino-British athlete is also known for starring in the Pinoy romantic reality TV series I Do Back. So not only can he tackle you on the field, he can thrill you with his thespian skills. Image from @hmorris140 on Instagram. SARACH YOOYEN, 25 Football, Thailand He’s a big hit in the Land Of A T...

item.title: Matthew aims to spread his wings further with goal against Thailand - The Star Online
item.description:
Matthew aims to spread his wings further with goal against Thailand  The Star Online

NATIONAL defender Matthew Davies (pic) is revelling in the freedom accorded to him in the SEA Games football squad. And he’s looking to cap it with a goal in the final against Thailand at the Shah Alam Stadium tonight. The Perth-born is among six players who did not feature in the team’s 3-0 loss to Thailand in the AFC Under-23 qualifiers in Bangkok in July. National Under-23 team coach Datuk Ong Kim Swee has pushed rightback Matthew to play a more attacking role on the right wing under the 3-4-3 formation and he now has three assists to his name. The Pahang skipper said that he needs to be...

item.title: Suzuki Cup: It's crunch time for Kim Swee - The Star Online
item.description:
Suzuki Cup: It's crunch time for Kim Swee  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: This is it. The time has come for national football coach Datuk Ong Kim Swee to fulfil the task accorded to him by the Football Association of Malaysia when they appointed him to the hot seat in January. FAM had set him one target: get the national team into the final of the AFF Suzuki Cup. And his task begins on Sunday when Malaysia kick off their Group B campaign against Cambodia at the Thuwunna Stadium in Yangon at 3pm (4.30pm Malaysian time). It’s been a rocky road since the day he took over from Dollah Salleh 10 months ago. Kim Swee’s record has been far from impressive ...

item.title: Khairy: Malaysia not pulling out from AFF Suzuki Cup - The Star Online
item.description:
Khairy: Malaysia not pulling out from AFF Suzuki Cup  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: The Cabinet has decided not to withdraw the Malaysian football team from the AFF Suzuki Cup in Myanmar, says Khairy Jamaluddin. The Youth and Sports Minister said the Government would use other means to protest the atrocities against ethnic Rohingyas in the Rakhine state there. "The Cabinet discussed the situation faced by the Rohingyas in Myanmar. We discussed what Malaysia's action would be, including the boycott of the ongoing AFF Cup. "The Cabinet decided not to pull out of the tournament and will pursue other avenues to raise our concerns and ask for action to be taken so wh...

item.title: Bring back Malaysia’s glory days of football - The Star Online
item.description:
Bring back Malaysia’s glory days of football  The Star Online

I REFER to your sports report “RM40mil in the red” (The Star, April 5) Now the cat is out of the bag. The Football Association of Malaysia (FAM) is in the red by 40 million ringgit. It is ludicrous. Can we blame newly elected FAM president Tunku Ismail Ibrahim of Johor for cracking the whip by sacking 20 staff, many of whom were deadwood and poor performers or in redundant jobs? Now it is reported many more heads will roll in order for FAM to be lean and effective in discharging its duty as guardian of football in our country. Tunku Ismail should do a manpower audit and due diligence to ens...

item.title: Thai football coach resigns after crushing World Cup bid - The Star Online
item.description:
Thai football coach resigns after crushing World Cup bid  The Star Online

BANGKOK: The coach of Thailand’s national football team has shocked fans by resigning from his post after leading the War Elephants through a disappointing 2018 World Cup bid. Kiatisak Senamuang, a former star Thai striker who has coached the team since 2014, announced the move on his Instagram account late Friday. “I am ceasing my role as head coach of the Thai national team,” he wrote beneath a photo of the players. “I want to thank all footballers, everyone in my team and all football fans including my family, who have always supported me,” he added. The move comes after Thailand endured...

item.title: Football gold is ours, says Thai coach - The Star Online
item.description:
Football gold is ours, says Thai coach  The Star Online

SEPANG: Thailand football coach Woorawoot Srimaka is no stranger to Malaysian football. The 45-year-old former national striker knows all about the game here and is confident that Thailand can return home with the gold medal. As a player, Woorawoot scored seven goals in the 9-0 rout of Malaysia’s 2000 Olympic team in a friendly in Bangkok in 1998. “Yes, I know Malaysian football. The rivalry has always been there and we’re here to win the gold again,” said Woorawoot, who played for Kelantan in the Premier League 13 years ago. He said that although the Thai team were assembled just a week ag...

item.title: Malaysia edge Cambodia 3-2 to win Suzuki Cup opener - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia edge Cambodia 3-2 to win Suzuki Cup opener  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Malaysia were made to sweat before edging Cambodia 3-2 in their AFF Suzuki Cup Group B opener at the Thuwunna Stadium in Yangoon.

item.title: Suzuki Cup: Skipper Amri remains positive of team ahead of tournament - The Star Online
item.description:
Suzuki Cup: Skipper Amri remains positive of team ahead of tournament  The Star Online

SHAH ALAM: National skipper Mohd Amri Yahyah is confident his team-mates will rise to the occasion in the AFF Suzuki Cup in Yangon from Nov 19 -26. The veteran attacker scored the winning goal from the penalty spot in the 46th minute in the 2-1 win over Papua New Guinea in a friendly at the Shah Alam Stadium on Monday. The Harimau Malaysia were earlier stunned by Nigel Dabinyaba (sixth minute) before striker Ahmad Hazwan Bakri equalised in the 21st minute. How far do you think Malaysia will progress in AFF Suzuki Cup? The Batu Karang-born Amri said their win over Papua showed that “we are r...

item.title: Vietnam down Malaysia 1-0 in Suzuki Cup - The Star Online
item.description:
Vietnam down Malaysia 1-0 in Suzuki Cup  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Malaysia’s hopes of qualifying for the AFF Suzuki Cup semi-finals were dented following a 1-0 loss to fancied Vietnam 1-0 at the Thuwunna Stadium in Yangon on Wednesday. Midfielder Nguyen Trong Hoang punished the ball-watching Malaysian defence with a brilliant goal in the 80th minute to virtually seal their ticket into the last four of the competition. Vietnam, who edged Myanmar 2-1 in the opening game on Sunday, have six points. Malaysia, who defeated Cambodia 3-2 in the opening game, are now left with a do-or-die mission against hosts Myanmar on Saturday for a semi-final s...

item.title: The rise of the Garuda, the fall of the Tigers - The Star Online
item.description:
The rise of the Garuda, the fall of the Tigers  The Star Online

TWO years ago, FIFA suspended Indonesia after the sports ministry and football association failed to resolve a dispute over who ran the sport in the country. When it comes to controversies, Indonesia is never short of it. In 2012, the Football Association of Indonesia (PSSI) received a warning for the divided state of Indonesian football. In that year, two separate leagues existed - The rebel Super League (ISL), which isn't recognised by the PSSI or FIFA, and the Premier League (IPL). Fans and even some national football federations were confused over the state of affairs. Safee Sali, who w...

item.title: SEA Games: Tense start to Malaysia-Thailand football final - The Star Online
item.description:
SEA Games: Tense start to Malaysia-Thailand football final  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Malaysia are off to a tense start in their SEA Games final football match against Thailand at the Shah Alam Stadium. Malaysia’s Under-23 men’s team got an early corner but were unable to make much of it in the first five minutes on Tuesday night’s match. Both teams are still trying to settle into their groove. The final is a repeat of the 2001 Kuala Lumpur SEA Games where Malaysia faced off against Thailand. The Malaysian team last won the gold medal in the 2011 Jakarta SEA Games, while Thailand are the defending champions. The team beat archnemesis Indonesia 1-0 in the semi-...
